result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Nathan Louis Miller

records.descr: Waiver of time limits for preliminary hearing

records.addlTxt:
9:14 AM Defendant Nathan Louis Miller in court.  Attorney Alysja Otten in court for Nathan Louis Miller.  Attorney Jennifer Gross in court for State of Wisconsin. Court calls case and recites appearances. DEF received copy of criminal complaint in court on this date.  DEF verifies DOB and address. Defendant advised of rights/penalties, acknowledges receipt of complaint, waives reading of complaint.  Through Counsel DEF enters NG Plea to Count 2, DEF waives time limits for preliminary hearing.    Requests Court set preliminary hearing.  Next Court Appearance Card completed by Court Officer and given to DEF.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for November 29, 2022 at 09:30 am.
Preliminary hearing on November 29, 2022 at 09:30 am.

VOLUNTARY APPEARANCE
NO CARD to send to Sheriff Dept, and Nothing to upload to sharefile.

11:29 AM Defendant Nathan Louis Miller in court.  Attorney Alysja Otten appeared by video for Nathan Louis Miller.  Attorney Jennifer Gross in court for State of Wisconsin. Court calls case and recites appearances.  Court addresses DEF on missed appearance, DEF responds.   Warrant quashed.   DEF request initial appearance to be reset for DEF to speak to attorney.  Court reset initial appearance.
Initial appearance scheduled for September 20, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Initial appearance on September 20, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Voluntary appearance/Initial appearance on August 31, 2022 at 11:00 am.

09:59 AM  Defendant Nathan Louis Miller not in court.  Attorney Alysja Otten in court for Nathan Louis Miller.  Attorney Jennifer Gross in court for State of Wisconsin.  Court calls case and recites appearances.   Attny Otten stands mute.  State requests warrant and bail forfeiture proceedings.   Court grants request.  Warrant authorized (Sawyer and Surrounding Counties) as requested.  Bail forfeiture stayed.
Initial appearance on August 30, 2022 at 08:30 am.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt:
ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY/ No Possession or Consumption of Alcoholic Beverages.  May not possess any controlled substance or paraphernalia.     No drug use without a valid prescription and if prescribed must take as DR ordered.  

Defendant shall be subject to testing of their blood, breath, saliva and/or urine to ensure compliance with absolute sobriety provision. Within 24 hours of release from custody (not including weekends/holidays) defendant shall report to Justice Point Pre-Trial Services at 10610 Main Street Suite 101, Hayward, WI 54843. Phone: 715-804-0109 OR 715-961-0149 for orientation and to establish testing procedures and options.

11:15 AM  DE Nathan Miller in court, appearing in custody by video from the Sawyer County Jail, with Atty Gabriel Pollak (special appearance) appeared by video.  Jennifer Gross appeared in person for the State of WI.  Court calls case and recites appearances.  DE verifies DOB and Address.  DE does qualify for public defender.  Court finds probable cause.  State makes bond recommendation.  Atty Pollak no objection.  Court sets bond. SIBS $1000 ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY/ No Possession or Consumption of Alcoholic Beverages.  May not possess any controlled substance or paraphernalia.     No drug use without a valid prescription and if prescribed must take as DR ordered.  

Defendant shall be subject to testing of their blood, breath, saliva and/or urine to ensure compliance with absolute sobriety provision. Within 24 hours of release from custody (not including weekends/holidays) defendant shall report to Justice Point Pre-Trial Services at 10610 Main Street Suite 101, Hayward, WI 54843. Phone: 715-804-0109 OR 715-961-0149 for orientation and to establish testing procedures and options.  Court sets INITIAL APPEARANCE for July 19, 2022 at 8:30AM.
